summary: Results of the 2020 Census will be used to apportion congressional seats, redraw districts, and allocate federal assistance. But the Census Bureau faces challenges, including: Controlling costs, estimated at $15.6 billion for 2020, up $3 billion from its original estimate. Counting a larger population in light of a historical decline in response rates. Managing innovations such as allowing online responses. Managing development and security of...
title: 2020 Census: Actions Needed to Mitigate Key Risks Jeopardizing a Cost-Effective Enumeration
